endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event in ISO 8601 format

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event in ISO 8601 format

attendanceDurationSeconds.description: The number of seconds the participation lasted

attendancePercentage.description: Percentage of the participation duration relative to the event duration

occurredAt.description: Timestamp of when the participation occurred

vid.description: The internal ID of the contact

attendees.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that attended this marketing event.

cancellations.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but later cancelled their registration.

createdAt.description: The creation date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.

eventCompleted.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been completed.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventType.description: The type of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

id.description: The ID of the marketing event CRM object.

noShows.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but did not attend. This field only had a value when the event is over.

objectId.description: The ID of the marketing event CRM object.

registrants.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

updatedAt.description: The update date and time of the marketing event.

externalAccountId.description: The account ID that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

externalEventId.description: The event ID that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

marketingEventId.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot

name.description: The name of the marketing event in HubSpot

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

contactProperties.description: The key-value set that contains properties of the contact.

email.description: The email address of the contact in HubSpot to associate with the event.

interactionDateTime.description: Timestamp in milliseconds at which the contact subscribed to the event.

properties.description: The key-value set that contains properties of the marketing event.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of the creation of the list

createdById.description: The ID of the user who created the list

deletedAt.description: Timestamp of the deletion of the list

filtersUpdatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last update of the list filters

listId.description: An internal ID of the list

listVersion.description: A number that represents a version of the list

objectTypeId.description: The internal ID of the object type of the list

processingStatus.description: Represents the current processing status of the list

size.description: The size of the result list

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last update of the list

updatedById.description: The ID of the user who last updated the list

appId.description: The id of the application that created the marketing event in HubSpot.

externalAccountId.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

value.description: The value of the property in the CRM

isEncrypted.description: Indicates whether the property is encrypted

isLargeValue.description: Indicates whether the property value is stored as a large value in the storage

persistenceTimestamp.description: The timestamp that indicates when the value being written is persisted in storage

selectedByUser.description: Indicates whether the property is selected

selectedByUserTimestamp.description: Timestamp of when the property was selected by the user

sourceId.description: ID of the source of the property

sourceLabel.description: Label of the source of the property

sourceMetadata.description: Source metadata encoded as a base64 string

sourceUpstreamDeployable.description: Indicates which upstream service made the property change

sourceVid.description: The unique identifier associated with the source.

updatedByUserId.description: The ID of the user who last updated the property

useTimestampAsPersistenceTimestamp.description: Indicates if the persistence timestamp is the same as storage version timestamp

PropertyValue.description: Represents a single custom property of a marketing event, storing its name, value, metadata (like source, timestamp, and sensitivity), and related audit information for tracking changes.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled. Defaults to `false`

eventCompleted.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been completed. Defaults to `false`

eventType.description: Describes what type of event this is.  For example: `WEBINAR`, `CONFERENCE`, `WORKSHOP`

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

id.description: The internal ID of the target marketing event
